workspace.name: Search part 1
workspace.query: (: This example will search all documents (in other words the entire database) for any documents containing the word "nuclear" regardless of case. The word can be found anywhere in the document, in any element or attribute, to satisfy this query. :) cts:search(fn:doc(), "nuclear")

(: Search for all doument containing the word nuclear anywhere in them and show firstname, surname, catergory and year in the result.
Since we have used namespace when loading the documents we need to specify it in order to select the elements. :)
declare namespace np = "http://marklogic.com/swe/nobel-prize";
let $results := cts:search(fn:doc(), "nuclear") for $result in $results return <winner> <name>{$result//np:firstname/string(),$result//np:surname/string()}</name> {$result//np:category,$result//np:year} </winner>

(: This example will search all documents (in other words the entire database) for any documents containing the word "sweden" in the <country> element. :) declare namespace np = "http://marklogic.com/swe/nobel-prize";
let $results := cts:search(fn:doc(), cts:element-word-query(xs:QName("np:country"),"sweden", "case-insensitive")) for $result in $results return <winner> <name>{$result//np:firstname/string(),$result//np:surname/string()}</name> {$result//np:category,$result//np:year, $result//np:country} </winner>

(: Using cts:search to find all documents where the word usa and nuclear exists somewhere in the same document. The words can be found anywhere in the document, in any element or attribute, to satisfy this query. :)
cts:search(fn:doc(), cts:and-query((cts:word-query("usa", "case-insensitive"), cts:word-query("nuclear", "case-insensitive"))))

(: Using cts:search to find all documents where the word studies and nuclear exists within 3 words from each other in the same text. The search is automaticlly using stemming, meaning we will also catch studying for example. :)
cts:search(fn:doc(), cts:near-query( (cts:word-query("nuclear"), cts:word-query("studies")), 3))
